children.text: The rendered feature mouldings that have been installed have visible cracks.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 9.10 Cracking in external mouldings, states that

‘Cracks in mouldings and/or other architectural features, including joints between those features and adjacent surfaces, are defective if they exist at handover or exceed 2mm in width within the first 24 months and can be seen from a normal viewing position’.
These mouldings will need to be rectified to ensure that cracking is not visible in accordance with the above.
